subject: Re: [junit] assertNotEquals and assertThrows
msgSnippet: ... That s cool.  I hope it s helping the design and implementation of your code--I know it helps mine. ... I can t comment on the history of assertNotEquals.
messageBody:
Nitay wrote:
> I've been using junit for a while now. These days every piece of java
> snippet I write has a test attached to it :).

That's cool. I hope it's helping the design and implementation of your
code--I know it helps mine.

> I was wondering why there are no assertNotEquals and assertThrows
> methods in
> the Assert class. I have needed something like this many times in my
> testing, and have had to fall back to doing assertFalse(a.equals(b)) and a
> sequence of try-catch-fail, respectively.

I can't comment on the history of assertNotEquals. assertThrows is hard
in a language like Java that doesn't have literal code blocks, but JUnit
4 handles it with the @Test(expected=NullPointerException.class) annotation.

David Saff
